page.title: 06The day of a farmer's wife
page.content: I get up around 6 o'clock every morning, rain or shine. Before breakfast I fetch the cows from the field on the hill. When my son has milked them, I bottle the milk - we have green tops to denote unpateurised milk. After having my breakfast, I deliver our milk to houses around Ecton and Warslow. When I return from my milk round, around 12 o'clock, I prepare and eat my dinner and feed the cats, hens etc. During the afternoon I do my housework, until about half past five when I have my tea. After tea I wash and sterilise the milk bottles ready for the next day. I then can relax watching television. I go to bed at about half past ten, after a busy day.
